description: From Middle English sperme, from Latin sperma, from Ancient Greek σπέρμα (spérma, “seed, semen”). Compare also Old French esperme, sparme.

nouns.description: sperm (countable and uncountable, plural sperm or sperms)

entries.meaning: (countable) The reproductive cell or gamete of the male; a spermatozoon.
examples: Seeing the two little moving cells – the result of her egg and Luke's sperm – was incredible, and two very long weeks later the clinic confirmed I was pregnant.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, slang) Semen; the generative substance of male animals.
(chemistry) Sperm oil; whale oil from a sperm whale; spermaceti.

verbs.description: sperm (third-person singular simple present sperms, present participle sperming, simple past and past participle spermed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang, vulgar) To ejaculate on or into.
